p: A total of 337 plant medicine recipes have been identified, of which 203 are composed of at least two species, for the treatment of 103 diseases. Diseases most commonly treated by traditional medicine in the study area are hemorrhoids, hernias, and sexual weakness or impotence. The leaf (39.4%) was the most commonly used organ, whereas decoction (41.7%) and oral intake (71.7%) were the most common preparation and administration methods, respectively, in all use reports (Fig. 2).
